reviews.review: Dead by Daylight √© um jogo divertido de jogar sozinho ou com amigos. Os desenvolvedores cagam para os bugs, mesmo ap√≥s mais de 3 anos. Os erros n√£o s√£o corrigidos infelizmente. Porem Novos Sobreviventes, Assassinos e Mapas continuam sendo adicionados aqui e ali. O √∫nico problema em que penso, pode ser que existem muitas pessoas t√≥xicas / rudes por a√≠ que gostam de tentar prejudic√°-lo se voc√™ estiver tendo um jogo ruim. Ningu√©m √© perfeito. Ningu√©m pode ter um jogo perfeito a cada jogo. Todo mundo tem jogos ruins que v√™m aqui e ali. As pessoas podem reclamar que voc√™ est√° jogando mal se voc√™ est√° cometendo um pequeno erro. Voc√™ joga do jeito que voc√™ gosta de jogar. N√£o deixe que outras pessoas o prejudiquem pelo jeito que voc√™ est√° jogando. Mas, caso contr√°rio, acho que o Dead by Daylight √© um √≥timo jogo que mant√©m as pessoas voltando e jogando esse jogo.
i recommand this game because its too good and exciting when you play it

The matchmaking is garbage. It is is so close to the point of unplayable. I am getting paired with ranks that aren't even close to mine and then I keep getting games with people half way around the world. Playing with 200+ ping is terrible.  The devs don't care either they never listen and just keep pumping crap out.

New game name "Alive by Daylight"

Dead by Daylight is a fun game to play alone or with friends. The devs keep updating the game a lot even after 3+ years. Bugs keeps getting fixed. New Survivors, Killers and Maps keeps getting added here and there. The only problem that i think of, can be that there is many toxic/rude people out there that likes to try and harm you if ur having a bad game. No one is perfect. No one can have perfect game every game. Everyone has bad games that comes here and there. People can complain about you playing bad if you're doing 1 little mistake. You play the way you like to play. Don't let other people harm you for the way you're playing. But otherwise i think Dead by Daylight is a great game that keeps people to come back and play this game.

After playing this game for many many hours, I can give a lot of feedback towards it. I still love every minute of this game even to this day. I have found majority of people jump to disliking this game simply because they lack the mechanics to play the game and get frustrated. Let me tell you that this game IS a very hard game to learn for a new player, having options such as trying to free yourself from the hook that is actually basically a "kill yourself" button and how could a new player know that right? I feel like this game is more tuned for the people who stick around and take the time to learn the game and its mechanics. When you finally begin to learn the mechanics and how thinks work, it becomes very addicting, because you understand how to do everything and grasp a sense of how to properly loop the killer, use items properly such as a flashlight, etc... I cannot stress this enough, the game is VERY hard in the beginning, but with time, it becomes manageable and a shit load of fun.

Pasted from steam forums, you can find it for yourself:
"Murf has Dead by Daylight 4 Jul, 2016 @ 4:19pm
Streamers and Youtubers
Since Dead By Daylight is geared towards streamers and it was launched with streamers and youtubers in mind we wanted to give you a place to post about your streams and videos. Same rules apply as in the general forum. Any non stream/YT(Vid) related threads will be removed."

That's all you need to do, are you a streamer? Then buy.
Are you a normal player not some dumb useless talentless baby that needs all the handicaps in the world to play? Then don't.
Unless you like to suffer OR get bored to death, cos that is the only 2 things this game offers.

its the most interesting game i ever played!

Dead by Daylight is a simple Hate-Love Relationship.
The game can be very Enjoyable, Scary, Fun it can eat up your afternoon really Easily.
But it can also be very Frustrating. It's hard to Master, there is no Hand-holding and it's Player versus Player so the opposing side can play rather dirty. (Not to say Toxic)
But all in all, gameplay wise i really wanna love this game. But it's nothing for Sore losers.
This game will take a lot, a lot of time to only become decent at it.
It's fun and it feels good to perform well in this game. But you need to Perform terrible a bunch of times before you can get there. So getting into this game is def. the hardest Part.

My Judgement on the Devs is kind off Split.
They worked a lot on this game, and i loved what happened with it. They are doing a good job... most of the time. They are adding a bunch of new Characters and Perks regulary and as of right now they are even reworking some of the older maps which is great.
My biggest downsides on the devs (And i want you to read all of it or don't read it at all) as of right now is that they seem to have forgotten what's fun and turned into golddiggers. The Halloween event which is one of the biggest events for this game was atrocious this year. They forgot everything great from the years before, and just added some mediocre skins. For 10‚Ç¨ each. The Event ended up being boring and mainly Disappointing.
BUT
BHVR did come up with a somewhat decent fix for it. It was still disappointing but you can at least say they were listening to the feedback. They also promised to improve it by a lot in the Future so something like this won't happen again. So right now i just i really hope that they will not ruin the Winter event as well. Otherwise i might just lose Faith and this turns into a "Not Recommend"

So, if you are willing to play a scary and challenging game, where you can Improve a lot over time. Go right for it.

The expected Nurse nerf made me think of the state of the game.

I invested quite some time in Dead by Daylight and it is by no means perfect or anything near balanced right now, but watching the changes the devs made in the last few years actually make me a little proud!

They made so many steps in the right direction:

1. There are no more infinites
2. There are less pallets 
3. There is no more pallet vacuum
4. Gens take longer as they used to and the killer has the opportunity to regress them
5. The implementation of the exhaustion mechanic was a great balance change
6. They nerfed a totally broken perk (deceisive strike), but still managed to keep it strong
7. They nerfed a totally broken killer perk (noed) and redesigned it in a way the survivor is to blame if the killer can even use it
8. They start to implement more fun perks which are strong but not overpowered (e.g. head on)
9. They reworked 4 weak killers (freddy, trapper, wraith and hag) and made them b-c tier
10. They finally nerf the one killer which ignores all basic mechanics of the game (nurse). Thx for that btw....the community was waiting for that far too long.

But dont get me wrong. There are still some things wrong with this game in its current state:

1. Communication is way too strong at the moment (just watch marth88`s experiences with his depip squad) and you can play with this opportunity without any handycap (e.g. remove perk slots etc)
2. Gen Rush still is a overpowered technique which basically requires 0 skill 
3. In the current meta a good killer tunnels and plays defensive because he has to. I hope i see the meta shift away from that. E.g. through crippling the survivor on his/ first hook so he does gens slower and the killer wants to have each survivor hooked at least once
4. Make doing gens more entertaining and skillfull than just pressing m1
5. The maps are way to inconsistent in its strength for a killer and a survivor

If those things arent going to get fixed in the next 1 year i might have to change my review, but for now..... i think you guys are doing "a pretty good job so far"
its definently in my top 5 of of the best games ive ever played.
bom jogo mas ninguem tava jogando hj

The game has no full screen option. If you select fullscreen from the options menu, instead, all you get is a windowed fullscreen that's not a proper fullscreen even. The windows task bar shows on the bottom. going to the GameUserSettings and properly enabling fullscreen mode causes an issue on my 4k monitor where clicking on menu items does not select it. Instead, i'd have to move it further away into nothing then see a menu button get highlighted. If i instead decide to torture myself with the default "fullscreen" setting, i'd end up clicking on the taskbar multiple times since the cursor isn't properly centered on the game window.

As of writing this review this game is no longer playable without a SWF. Solo Queue is just people killing themselves on hooks and AFKing all the time. Literally can't even get one gen done before someone is hooked and already trying to kill themselves to derank or they don't like the killer they're playing against.
I really love this game! But one suggestion is to try and release it on mac and make it cross play so there is more of a community.

The game is getting better and has never been as good as it is right now but there are lots of annoying long standing issues (i.e.: infinite loads and a nasty memory leak) that keep this game from being great. Worse yet, new issues are often being introduced that by all reasonable expectations should have been caught with any good Q/A pass. But where things get really bad is with some in the player base: salt and toxicity are seen by some as a badge of honour meanwhile rage D/C'ing are still not punished or the effects mitigated in any meaningful way.

The matchmaking is an ever changing beast on unknowns, your lobby queue's can be instant to 10min+. The ranking scheme is silly (and yet better than ever!!) and the post-trial rank progression evaluation is heavily tilted to certain killer kits (i.e.: Legion has easy rank progress, Plague and Myers are punished). And you can forget about a feeling that the game is fair, you will inevitably and frequently be in near unwinnable situations as well as feeling wildly overpowered as map design, RNG spawning and some suspicious matchmaking / smurfing ... *sigh* ... oddly I see this variability as a net plus but eventually it triggers nearly everyone to want to uninstall at some point.

But a significant number of frustrated players (myself included) keep coming back in part because the game is designed to be an addictive ongoing slog of intermittent rewards. If you have an addictive disposition such as obsessive compulsive tendencies, struggle to self regulate, are dealing with social anxiety or depression then AVOID this game. The game has a horrible progression grind to unlock all the perks and an even longer grind in getting said perks on the characters you want. Seriously, unless you're willing to put over a thousand hours into this game -OR- you're super casual DO NOT get into this game. Anyone who has limited time AND wants to unlock most of this game's content will be frustrated and walk away unsatisfied.

That said, the fundamental genre and gameplay mechanics can be fun and with the right killer/team mix it'll be a downright silly improv skit among mostly 5 strangers. There is a culture and growing communal gameplay language and identity that can be funny with a sense of belonging as you reinforce the various evolving spontaneous meme's. If you can just keep focused on the cat and mouse mechanics and jokes, ignore the toxic players and don't fuss over progression then this game is solid.

As for me? DBD, I want to quit you. Too many hours burned, too many insults and bad manners by others that sometimes make me play too aggressive, too many long standing bugs that seem to be more like inside jokes/pranks than issues that BHVR should take seriously. I just want to chase and be chased or be a sneaky ghost and laugh at mistakes made... but the game keeps diverging into a circle jerk of blame and hostile projected insecurities with no mechanisms on BHVR's part to reduce the toxic results.
I really love this game and I hope the devs continue to improve the game.  It's one of the few multiplayer games I find myself constantly playing.

If you are around 10 years of age and you have a lower intelligence than the rest of ur peers, this game is for you. Thats what my sister is but now even she agrees this game is full of trolls and cheaters.

-Le jeu est bien bon d√©lire entre pote rien a dire sur ce coup la.

Points n√©gatifs :
-Il y a des tueurs qui sont vachement CHEAT , en gros tu peux rien faire a part prier pour qu'il rate son coup.
-Quand tu incarne un survivant et que tu traverse sur une fen√™tre du jeu , bah tu te prend un coup b√™tement.
-Le sous-sol de ce jeu foire totalement tout ! En gros dans ce sous-sol , il y a juste un escalier pour partir en bas et en ressortir bref si le tueur est dans les barrages (c'est pratiquement toujours le cas) tu es dans la merde.
